Nightshift takes his time going into the tunnel as he scans the way constan=
tly for signs of unwanted company.

" Can never be too careful.  Especially=
 in these kinda situations.  Now ta find out if I was right about someone h=
ack'n the systems."

He continues but at a cautious pace, keeping close to =
the cover of darkness as he can.

Don't be envious of what you don't have, =
be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than fami=
ly and friends.

On Nov 16, 2011, at 12:14 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonu=
s@...> wrote:

> > <O>D>
> >
> > Nightshift hesitates for a moment an=
d then starts to dig at the snow,
> > minding his actions so he doesn't kic=
k up too much activity to be noticed.
> > He finds the opening and stops to=
 scan it for trip alarms.
> >
> > " Yep, it's here like ya said, Sir. Scann=
ing for trip alarm beams now.
> > Noth'n is too easy when it looks it. Lear=
ned that in special ops training."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> It is easy to note that =
had not POLAR CLAW not pointed out where the
> door was located it would ha=
ve been exceedingly difficult to find. It
> was thick made of some sort of =
strong and desnse metal, but it was
> shapped to look just like the stone t=
hat it was built into.
> 
> POLAR CLAW nodded, "Good training." He said as =
NIGHTSHIFT's scanners
> brought a sophisticated network on and around the d=
oor. A silent
> alarm, one that would electricfy the door.
> 
> "Just a mom=
ent." PROWL said as he heard the small pings from
> NIGHTSHIFT's scanners. =
He reached down and tapped in a small
> identification code, and then after=
 a moment NIGHTSHIFT's scanner read
> all clear.
> 
> RAMULUS shrugged as W=
OLFGANG, "You can be to careful as far as back doors go."
> 
> There was a =
grunt from POLAR CLAW as part of one of his shoulder
> cannos ejected and t=
ransformed into what looked somehting like a bat.
> 
> "This is Batscout." =
POLAR CLAW said by way of introducing it to
> NIGHTSHIFT as BATSCOUT kind o=
f looped around for a moment.
> 
> "He is my drone unit and he will accompa=
ny you. He is well trained in
> tracking and surveillance operations." As h=
e spoke POLAR CLAW laid his
> hand on the door then it flashed as it read h=
is hand print. "He will
> have all the passcodes you need and he can let us=
 know if you run into
> any problems."
> 
> The door clicked once and then =
hissed and then began to slowly open
> revealing a long dark tunnel, cold a=
ir wooshed out.

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift takes his time=
 going into the tunnel as he scans the way constantly for signs of unwanted=
 company.</div><div><br></div><div>" Can never be too careful.  Especi=
ally in these kinda situations.  Now ta find out if I was right about =
someone hack'n the systems."</div><div><br></div><div>He continues but at a=
 cautious pace, keeping close to the cover of darkness as he can.<br><br>Do=
n't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already p=
osses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.</div><div><br>O=
n Nov 16, 2011, at 12:14 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a href=3D"mailto:supercycl=
onus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></=
div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>














<span style=3D"display:no=
ne"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>>=
 <O>D><br>
><br>
> Nightshift hesitates for a moment and the=
n starts to dig at the snow,<br>
> minding his actions so he doesn't kic=
k up too much activity to be noticed.<br>
> He finds the opening and sto=
ps to scan it for trip alarms.<br>
><br>
> " Yep, it's here like ya s=
aid, Sir.  Scanning for trip alarm beams now.<br>
> Noth'n is too easy w=
hen it looks it.  Learned that in special ops training."<br>
<br>
<NEW&g=
t;<br>
<br>
It is easy to note that had not POLAR CLAW not pointed out wher=
e the<br>
door was located it would have been exceedingly difficult to find=
. It<br>
was thick made of some sort of strong and desnse metal, but it was=
<br>
shapped to look just like the stone that it was built into.<br>
<br>
P=
OLAR CLAW nodded, "Good training." He said as NIGHTSHIFT's scanners<br>
bro=
ught a sophisticated network on and around the door. A silent<br>
alarm, on=
e that would electricfy the door.<br>
<br>
"Just a moment." PROWL said as h=
e heard the small pings from<br>
NIGHTSHIFT's scanners. He reached down and=
 tapped in a small<br>
identification code, and then after a moment NIGHTSH=
IFT's scanner read<br>
all clear.<br>
<br>
RAMULUS shrugged as WOLFGANG, "Y=
ou can be to careful as far as back doors go."<br>
<br>
There was a grunt f=
rom POLAR CLAW as part of one of his shoulder<br>
cannos ejected and transf=
ormed into what looked somehting like a bat.<br>
<br>
"This is Batscout." P=
OLAR CLAW said by way of introducing it to<br>
NIGHTSHIFT as BATSCOUT kind =
of looped around for a moment.<br>
<br>
"He is my drone unit and he will ac=
company you. He is well trained in<br>
tracking and surveillance operations=
." As he spoke POLAR CLAW laid his<br>
hand on the door then it flashed as =
it read his hand print. "He will<br>
have all the passcodes you need and he=
 can let us know if you run into<br>
any problems."<br>
<br>
The door click=
ed once and then hissed and then began to slowly open<br>
revealing a long =
dark tunnel, cold air wooshed out.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
